title: 115_hr1761
content: The Act may be cited as the "Protecting Against Child Exploitation Act of 2017" and addresses sexual exploitation of children. Section 2251 of title 18, United States Code, is amended to address the sexual exploitation of children, including actions such as employing minors for sexually explicit conduct, producing visual depictions of minors engaged in such conduct, transmitting live depictions, having minors assist in such conduct, and transporting minors across state lines for such purposes. The amendment to Section 2251 of title 18, United States Code, addresses the sexual exploitation of children, including actions such as employing minors for sexually explicit conduct, producing visual depictions of minors engaged in such conduct, and transporting minors across state lines for such purposes. Parents or guardians who knowingly permit minors to engage in sexually explicit conduct for the production of visual depictions will also be punished. The amendment to Section 2251 of title 18, United States Code addresses the sexual exploitation of children by prohibiting engaging in sexually explicit conduct, producing visual depictions of such conduct, and transporting minors across state lines for these purposes. The amendment also includes provisions regarding the transportation or transmission of visual depictions using interstate or foreign commerce. The section prohibits the production or transmission of visual depictions of sexually explicit conduct involving minors using interstate or foreign commerce. No criminal charges can be brought against electronic communication service providers unless they intentionally transmit such depictions. No criminal charges can be brought against electronic communication service providers for transmitting visual depictions of minors engaged in sexually explicit conduct unless they do so intentionally with actual knowledge. Section 2258B of title 18, United States Code is amended to provide limited liability for individuals responding to search warrants or legal process. Passed by the House of Representatives on May 25, 2017.
